description: 200-day trend analysis of current portfolio positions, identifying which holdings show the steepest price trends over the past 8 months. This analysis uses linear regression to measure trend slope steepness, statistical strength (R-squared), and long-term momentum sustainability for each position.

body.description: Stock symbol showing the steepest positive 200-day trend with strongest upward momentum in your portfolio
Daily price increase rate in dollars per day over 200 days. NVDA has gained an average of $2.85 per trading day, indicating exceptionally strong long-term growth momentum
Geometric angle of the upward trend line. Values above 45° indicate steep upward trends, while NVDA's 68.2° represents extremely strong bullish momentum
Statistical strength of the upward trend (0-1 scale). NVDA's 0.847 means 84.7% of price movement follows the trend line, indicating highly consistent directional momentum
Total percentage gain over the 200-day period. NVDA has more than doubled in value, representing exceptional long-term performance among your holdings
Position showing the steepest negative 200-day trend, representing the weakest long-term momentum in your portfolio
Daily price decline rate of $0.42 per trading day over 200 days. This consistent downward pressure indicates sustained selling pressure and weakening fundamentals
Geometric angle of the downward trend line. Negative angles below -15° indicate concerning long-term weakness that may warrant portfolio review
Statistical consistency of the downward trend. PYPL's 0.672 means 67.2% of price movement follows the declining trend, showing persistent weakness rather than temporary volatility
Total percentage decline over 200 days. PYPL has lost nearly one-third of its value, making it the worst long-term performer in your current portfolio
Position with highest R-squared value, indicating most predictable and consistent price movement pattern over 200 days
MSFT shows 89.1% trend consistency, meaning its price movement is highly predictable and follows a clear directional pattern with minimal random volatility
Position with lowest R-squared despite having a trend, indicating high volatility around the trend line and less predictable price movement
TSLA's 23.4% trend consistency means only about one-quarter of its price movement follows a predictable pattern, with high volatility making trend-following strategies risky
Overall trend breakdown of your 10 positions: 60% show positive long-term trends, 30% show negative trends, and 10% are trading sideways with no clear direction
Average daily gain rate across positions with positive 200-day trends. Your winning positions are gaining an average of $1.25 per day, indicating strong long-term portfolio momentum
Average daily loss rate across positions with negative trends. Your losing positions are declining by an average of $0.32 per day, suggesting controlled downside risk
Overall portfolio trend health score based on slope steepness, consistency, and distribution. Score above 7.0 indicates strong long-term momentum with well-balanced risk management

body.value: Hold NVDA, Review PYPL, Monitor TSLA volatility
body.description: Strategic recommendations based on trend analysis: Continue holding strongest performers, consider reducing exposure to consistent decliners, and manage high-volatility positions with tighter risk controls
